wiki.summary: Originally released in 2010 across two splits, one with When Bitter Spring Sleeps on Pagan Flames and one with Skagos on Flenser. A DLP release of Panopticon's material is being brought out in 2011 by Flenser Records. The samples on the album are from Ingmar Bergman's film The Seventh Seal. Splits' tracklist: Panopticon/When Bitter Spring Sleeps 1. Panopticon - Living in the Valley of the Shadow of Death (11:33) 2. Panopticon - Living Eulogy (7:33) Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: Originally released in 2010 across two splits, one with When Bitter Spring Sleeps on Pagan Flames and one with Skagos on Flenser. A DLP release of Panopticon's material is being brought out in 2011 by Flenser Records. The samples on the album are from Ingmar Bergman's film The Seventh Seal. Splits' tracklist: Panopticon/When Bitter Spring Sleeps 1. Panopticon - Living in the Valley of the Shadow of Death (11:33) 2. Panopticon - Living Eulogy (7:33) 3. Panopticon - To Make an Idol of Our Fear and Call It God (6:31) 4. When Bitter Spring Sleeps - Flames That Taste the Rain (9:37) 5. When Bitter Spring Sleeps - We Cower in the Storms of Her Retribution (11:14) 6. When Bitter Spring Sleeps - All Things Rise (Arrowwood cover) (5:58) Skagos/Panopticon 1. Skagos - Smoldering Embers (12:33) 2. Skagos - Anamnesis II: A Dry, Sterile Thunder, Without Rain (15:15) 3. Panopticon - A Message to the Missionary (7:08) 4. Panopticon - ..Seeing.. (8:08) 5. Panopticon - Watching You (featuring, and co-written with, Jack Hannert) (9:14) DLP tracklist: A1. Living in the Valley of the Shadow of Death (11:33) B1. Living Eulogy (7:33) B2. To Make an Idol of Our Fear and Call It God (6:31) C1. A Message to the Missionary (7:08) C2. ..Seeing.. (8:08) D1. Watching You (featuring, and co-written with, Jack Hannert) (9:14) Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
